Reviews.Title: “Hotel Par Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Martin G
Reviews.Content: I really give kudos to the staff for their warm reception on the night of March 6, 2012 when I arrived at the hotel in the company of a friend in transit to Lagos, Nigeria, the next morning. I was greeted with a single but large room with 2 beds and I had a really good night rest. In the morning, you will be humbled with the sumptuous and what I can describe as a mega breakfast - pardon me! I was also delighted to discover that the hotel is located in a busy textile/fashion centre in Istanbul when I took a long stroll around the area walking up the street to the games park on the street to the road behind visiting some shops and back to the hotel. I love to commend the staff and management for an excellent service and to thank the airline for making my trip a worthwhile one with a transit to experience the hospitality in Istanbul. Well done and all the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamer1
Reviews.Content: A friend of the family actually recommended me to stay at this hotel and was not disappointed one little bit.The room was spacious,clean,the staff was friendly,the breakfast was fantastic,and the location of this hotel was great..Good in every way.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location to merter market”
Reviews.Author: kikokarim
Reviews.Content: wonderful staff very clean and good size room ....i stayed twice in this hotel and soon will be back to istanbul and sure in gunes (the sun) hotel : )

Reviews.Title: “Convinient transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucanac
Reviews.Content: Stayed several night at Gunes Hotel as I was working at the Expo centre (close to the airport) and wanted to be a bit closer to the city. The hotel itself is situated in a residential neighborhood, 10min on foot to metro (Metro) and 15min to Zeytinburnu (Tram). The tram goes straight through downtown (Blue Mosque, Bazar and all the way to Kabatas). So it is perfect for being between the airport and the city on a short layover. The buffet is excellent, probably one of the best I've had for a 4star hotel. There are numerous local clothes shops en route to Zeytinburnu, nice shirts, pants etc for less than $5USD. Downside, since the hotel is in a residential area it is hard to find food after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: kanadai
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Gunes Hotel in early May. We planned on staying in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul but we had less than 16 hours so we decided to stay fairly close to the airport. Our room was very clean, the staff were friendly and professional and the breakfast was the best we've ever had in an Istanbul hotel. Although the hotel is not in a touristy area, the streets were still lively with lots of restaurants and shops to choose from. The metro stop is also very close and we were tempted to take a ride into the city. We would definitely go back to this hotel next time we're in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: divingmonkee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in transit through Istanbul. The hotel was 20 mins by Taxi from the airport (20TL there, and about 25TL back to airport). Checkin was quick and the room was really clean and comfrtable for a good sleep. Reasonably quiet. Breakfast was a typical affair for Turkey. Unsure of how it stacks up for ease of visiting the inner city tourist areas and how close it is to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to airport with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mchayford
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night as I was flying in to Istanbul and then flying out the next day. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very accomodating. This is in a lively neighborhood with shopping, restaurants and conveniences nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for transit passengers”
Reviews.Author: comnen
Reviews.Content: Turkish Airlines provides transit passengers with overnight stopover with a hotel. Gunes hotel is one of possible option. I liked the location (between Merter and Zaitinburnu), so one can easily take metro. The hotel is average, but clean, rooms are spacious, wifi available. Staff is polite. it is not 5 star hotel, it pretends to be 4-star, but I think it is 3+.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel as advertised”
Reviews.Author: MRRHouston
Reviews.Content: As part of a group, my husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days. First, the hotelâ€™s self-proclaimed 4-star rating is completely misleading. Be advised that hotels with a 4 star rating in Turkey are in no way the equivalent of 4-star hotels in either the U.S. or Europe. Turkey has something dubbed a â€œsuperior 4-starâ€� which may be close to the standards of the rest of the world, but their ordinary 4-star is closer to a pretty sketchy 3-star hotel elsewhere. So, by all mean, lower expectations if you intend to stay at the Gunes. The rooms are dated and in need of refurbishment. Within a minute of arrival, we tried to open the window in the room and the hinge promptly broke. The next morning when taking our showers, we were greeted with alternately hot and cold water which barely dripped out of the shower head. This was not unique to our room, because others in our group complained of the same thing. Then, I pulled on the ancient air dryer to start it only to pull it out of its socket. The good news is that the Gunesâ€™ staff is courteous and attentive and promptly fixed both the window and the hair dryer (although the hair dryer never actually blew hot air). Also, be ware of the location of the hotel. If you are looking for an airport hotel (Ata Turk), then you are fine. If you are interested in exploring Istanbul, it takes around 30-40 minutes in typical Istanbul traffic to get into the heart of the city from the hotel. The upside to the hotel is its very lavish breakfast that is included in the price of the room. All in all, though, for the prices they charge, you can get a much better deal in the heart of town.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillwillW
Reviews.Content: good hotel nice bar but very bad wifi network !!

Reviews.Title: “SAFE HARBOR WITH NO FRILLS.”
Reviews.Author: StudioChinn
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, clean and reliable hotel with attentive staff. Cleanliness is constant throughout. Rooms and furnishings are dated but well maintained. Few extras here but the breakfast is bountiful and served from 0630-1030. The lift was out on our visit but the rooms were on first floor. Location is remote from tourist sites or airport. It is in a densely built and populated neighborhood. It seemed quite secure with no loiterers or other characters around. BTW there is a small market just up the street 50-70 meters they stays open late for food, snacks, etc. Bar has EFES pilsener beer on tap, EFES dark in bottles, but not cheap

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a ways out of town”
Reviews.Author: GracyInVienna
Reviews.Content: We did something unthinkable for our trip to Istanbul. We got a package tour with air and hotel when we didn't know details on the flights nor the hotel ahead of time. It was too good of a deal to pass up. But you get is a nice hotel out in the sticks. To be fair, the hotel is in fairly good shape with fairly spacious rooms, clean, a good choice of channels on the TV, free wireless Internet and very good breakfast buffet. The rooms themselves are starting to show signs of wear and tear. A minor renovation will be in order soon. My biggest complaint was location. We normally like to get a hotel right in the thick of things so that we can stumble home at any hour of the day we wish. The Gunes is a ten minute walk to the Zeytinburnu stop where you can pick up the T1 tram to the center. The tram ride to Sultanahmet is 25 minutes which is where most of the good stuff is located. It is another 10 minutes or so to the other end, Kabatas, where it is about another 10 minute walk to the Palace. That, to me, is too far away.

Reviews.Title: “good for transit stay”
Reviews.Author: Nana_JP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gunes overnight during a long layover between flights. I wanted an inexpensive hotel close to the airport and the Gunes fills that goal nicely. It is about 20 minutes from the airport by taxi with a friendly staff and clean, comfortable rooms. The hotel is located in a busy neighborhood and, if I had more time, I think it would be fun to explore since there were a variety of shops and restaurants. This is not a modern hotel with frills but quite acceptable for quick or budget stays.
